intro: Cereus lepidotus, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a species of cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, columnar stem and spiny, ribbed structure. The plant produces large, fragrant flowers that open at night, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water. Its striking floral display makes it a popular choice for gardeners and collectors.
